definition: lit. to hope one's son becomes a dragon (idiom); fig. to long for one' s child to succeed in life/to have great hopes for one's offspring/to give one's child the best education as a career investment
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: This is that parents long to see the son succeed in life, look at the woman Cheng Feng's only method?
sentences.chinese: 這難道就是家長們望子成龍，望女成鳳的唯一做法嗎？

sentences.english: This implies that the parents hopeful psychology.
sentences.chinese: 這背後，是父母望子成龍的心理。

sentences.english: Poor parental love, the parents Succeed is also a human.
sentences.chinese: 可憐天下父母心，家長們望子成龍也是人之常情。

sentences.english: He longs to see his children succeed in life, but he neglects their feelings.
sentences.chinese: 他總是望子成龍，卻沒有考慮到孩子們的感受。

definition: lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
the return of a prodigal son (idiom)
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
to stake all on one throw
to be successful in one's studies/academic success
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
every hope turns to dust (idiom); completely disheartened
